Interface_name: Java Netty UDP Client or Server
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a UDP server using Netty framework, with support for multiple transport types (NIO, Epoll, KQueue, IOUring) and graceful shutdown capabilities.

Class Description: GeyserServer is a Netty-based UDP server implementation that handles network communication using the most optimal transport available on the system. It manages server lifecycle including binding to ports and graceful shutdown.

Attributes:
- TRANSPORT: [Transport] - Static final field holding the best available transport type
- SHUTDOWN_QUIET_PERIOD_MS: [int] - Milliseconds to wait for quiet period during shutdown
- SHUTDOWN_TIMEOUT_MS: [int] - Maximum milliseconds to wait for shutdown
- geyser: [GeyserImpl] - Reference to the main Geyser implementation
- group: [EventLoopGroup] - Parent event loop group for the server
- childGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Child event loop group for handling connections
- bootstrap: [ServerBootstrap] - Netty server bootstrap instance
- playerGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Event loop group for player connections
- bootstrapFutures: [ChannelFuture[]] - Array of channel futures for server binding

Methods:
- GeyserServer([GeyserImpl geyser, int threadCount]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the server with specified thread count
- bind([InetSocketAddress address]) -> [CompletableFuture<Void>] - Binds the server to the specified address and returns a future
- shutdown() -> [void] - Gracefully shuts down the server and releases all resources
- createBootstrap() -> [ServerBootstrap] - Private method that creates and configures the server bootstrap
- compatibleTransport() -> [Transport] - Static private method that detects the best available transport
- isClassAvailable([String className]) -> [boolean] - Static private helper method to check class availability

Nested Types:
- Transport: [record] - Holds transport-specific channel class and event loop group factory
